t: Psalm 33
The Steadfast Love of the Lord
Shout*pn for joy in the Lord,*s O you righteous! Praise*ld befits the upright.
Give*ln thanks to the Lord*s with the lyre; make*ld melody to him with the harp of ten strings!
Sing*ln to him a new song; play*ld skillfully on the strings, with loud shouts.
For*pn the word of the Lord*s is upright, and*ld all his work is done in faithfulness.
He*ln loves righteousness and justice; the*ld earth is full of the steadfast love of the Lord.*s
By*pn the word of the Lord*s the heavens were made, and*ld by the breath of his mouth all their host.
He*ln gathers the waters of the sea as a heap; he*ld puts the deeps in storehouses.
Let*pn all the earth fear the Lord;*s let*ld all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him!
For*ln he spoke, and it came to be; he*ld commanded, and it stood firm.
The*pn Lord*s brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; he*ld frustrates the plans of the peoples.
The*ln counsel of the Lord*s stands forever, the*ld plans of his heart to all generations.
Blessed*ln is the nation whose God is the Lord,*s the*ld people whom he has chosen as his heritage!
The*pn Lord*s looks down from heaven; he*ld sees all the children of man;
from*ln where he sits enthroned he looks out on*ld all the inhabitants of the earth,
he*ln who fashions the hearts of them all and*ld observes all their deeds.
The*ln king is not saved by his great army; a*ld warrior is not delivered by his great strength.
The*ln war horse is a false hope for salvation, and*ld by its great might it cannot rescue.
Behold,*pn the eye of the Lord*s is on those who fear him, on*ld those who hope in his steadfast love,
that*ln he may deliver their soul from death and*ld keep them alive in famine.
Our*pn soul waits for the Lord;*s he*ld is our help and our shield.
For*ln our heart is glad in him, because*ld we trust in his holy name.
Let*ln your steadfast love, O Lord,*s be upon us, even*ld as we hope in you.
